page.title: 18THE ROYAL VISIT
page.content: The 23rd of July was a special day for the residents of North Hykeham, for this was the day that {Princess {Diana}, the {Princess of Wales} came to open the old peoples centre at Beckside. Crowds started to line the route along Lincoln Road down through the village and upto the entrance of Beckside from early on the day. Many crash barriers were put in position along the route and also around the Village Green. Bunting was hung from the houses and a large flag pole was erected on the 'Green'. Many people gathered to play some of the games at the stalls that were put up and their was a quiet carnival atmosphere as the crowd waited for the Princess'arrival. The sun shone hard on the crowd, a change from the rainy weather that had been present for the past week or so. People waved their flags as if to
